00014   proc add_bindings {txt} {
00015 
00016     bind indent$txt <Any-Key> "[ns indent]::check_indent %W insert"
00017     bind indent$txt <Return>  "[ns indent]::newline %W insert"
00018 
00019     # Add the indentation tag into the bindtags list just after Text
00020     set text_index [lsearch [bindtags $txt.t] Text]
00021     bindtags $txt.t [linsert [bindtags $txt.t] [expr $text_index + 1] indent$txt]

00061   ######################################################################
00062   # Checks the given text prior to the insertion marker to see if it
00063   # matches the unindent expressions.  Increment/decrement
00064   # accordingly.
00065   proc check_indent {txt index} {
00066 
00067     variable indent_exprs
00068 
00069     # If the auto-indent feature was disabled, we are in vim start mode, or
00070     # the current language doesn't have an indent expression, quit now
00071     if {!$indent_exprs($txt,enabled) || [[ns vim]::in_vim_mode $txt]} {
00072       return
00073     }
00074 
00075     # If the current line contains an unindent expression, is not within a comment or string,
00076     # and is preceded in the line by only whitespace, replace the whitespace with the proper
00077     # indentation whitespace.
00078     if {([set uindex [$txt search -regexp -- "[join $indent_exprs($txt,unindent) |]\$" "$index linestart" $index]] ne "") && \
00079          ![ctext::inCommentString $txt $uindex]} {
00080       set line [$txt get "$index linestart" $uindex]
00081       if {($line ne "") && ([string trim $line] eq "")} {
00082         $txt replace "$index linestart" $uindex [get_indent_space $txt 1.0 $index]
00083       }
00084     }
00085 
00086   }

00088   ######################################################################
00089   # Handles a newline character.  Returns the character position of the
00090   # first line of non-space text.
00091   proc newline {txt index} {
00092 
00093     variable indent_exprs
00094 
00095     # If the auto-indent feature was disabled, we are in vim start mode,
00096     # or the current language doesn't have an indent expression, quit now
00097     if {!$indent_exprs($txt,enabled) || [[ns vim]::in_vim_mode $txt]} {
00098       return
00099     }
00100 
00101     # Get the current indentation level
00102     set indent_space [get_indent_space $txt 1.0 $index]
00103 
00104     # Check to see if the previous space is greater than the indent space (if so use it instead)
00105     set prev_space [get_previous_indent_space $txt $index]
00106     if {[string length $prev_space] > [string length $indent_space]} {
00107       set indent_space $prev_space
00108     }
00109 
00110     # Get the current line
00111     set line [$txt get $index "$index lineend"]
00112 
00113     # Create an index to restore the insertion cursor, if necessary
00114     set restore_insert ""
00115 
00116     # Remove any leading whitespace and update indentation level
00117     # (if the first non-whitespace char is a closing bracket)
00118     if {[regexp {^( *)(.*)} $line -> whitespace rest] && ($rest ne "")} {
00119 
00120       # If the first non-whitespace characters match an unindent pattern,
00121       # lessen the indentation by one
00122       if {[regexp [subst {^[join $indent_exprs($txt,unindent) |]}] $rest]} {
00123         $txt insert insert "$indent_space\n"
00124         set restore_insert [$txt index insert-1c]
00125         set indent_space [string range $indent_space [[ns preferences]::get Editor/IndentSpaces] end]
00126       }
00127 
00128       # See if we are deleting a multicursor
00129       set mcursor [lsearch [$txt tag names $index] "mcursor"]
00130 
00131       # Delete the whitespace
00132       $txt delete $index "$index+[string length $whitespace]c"
00133 
00134       # If the newline was from a multicursor, we need to re-add the tag since we have deleted it
00135       if {$mcursor != -1} {
00136         $txt tag add mcursor $index
00137       }
00138 
00139     }
00140 
00141     # Insert leading whitespace to match current indentation level
00142     if {$indent_space ne ""} {
00143       $txt insert $index $indent_space
00144     }
00145 
00146     # If we need to restore the insertion cursor, do it now
00147     if {$restore_insert ne ""} {
00148       $txt mark set insert $restore_insert
00149     }
00150 
00151   }

00154   # Returns the indentation (in number of spaces) of the previous line
00155   # of text.
00156   proc get_previous_indent_space {txt index} {
00157 
00158     variable indent_exprs
00159     
00160     if {!$indent_exprs($txt,enabled) || \
00161         [[ns vim]::in_vim_mode $txt] || \
00162         ([lindex [split $index .] 0] == 1)} {
00163       return 0
00164     }
00165 
00166     set line_pos [expr [lindex [split [$txt index $index] .] 0] - 1]
00167 
00168     while {($line_pos > 0) && ([string trim [set line [$txt get "$line_pos.0" "$line_pos.end"]]] eq "")} {
00169       incr line_pos -1
00170     }
00171 
00172     if {($line_pos > 0) && [regexp {^( *)(.*)} $line -> whitespace rest]} {
00173       return $whitespace
00174     } else {
00175       return ""
00176     }
00177 
00178   }

00181   # This procedure counts the number of tags in the given range.
00182   proc get_tag_count {txt tag start end} {
00183     
00184     variable indent_exprs
00185     
00186     # Initialize the indent_level
00187     set count 0
00188     
00189     # Count all tags that are not within comments or are escaped
00190     while {[set range [$txt tag nextrange _$tag $start $end]] ne ""} {
00191       lassign $range index start
00192       if {![ctext::inCommentString $txt $index]} {
00193         incr count [expr [regexp -all $indent_exprs($txt,$tag) [$txt get $index $start]] - [ctext::isEscaped $txt $index]]
00194       }
00195     }
00196     
00197     return $count
00198     
00199   }

00202   # This procedure is called to get the indentation level of the given
00203   # index.
00204   proc get_indent_space {txt start end} {
00205 
00206     # Get the current indentation level
00207     set indent_level [expr [get_tag_count $txt indent $start $end] - [get_tag_count $txt unindent $start $end]] 
00208 
00209     return [string repeat " " [expr $indent_level * [[ns preferences]::get Editor/IndentSpaces]]]
00210

00214   # Formats the given str based on the indentation information of the text
00215   # widget at the current insertion cursor.
00216   proc format_text {txt startpos endpos} {
00217 
00218     variable indent_exprs
00219 
00220     # If the current language doesn't have indentation enabled, quit now
00221     if {!$indent_exprs($txt,enabled)} {
00222       return
00223     }
00224 
00225     # Get the current position and recalculate the endpos
00226     set currpos [$txt index "$startpos linestart"]
00227     set endpos  [$txt index $endpos]
00228 
00229     # Update the indentation level at the start of the first text line
00230     if {[$txt compare $startpos == 1.0]} {
00231       set indent_space ""
00232     } else {
00233       set indent_space [get_indent_space $txt 1.0 "$startpos-1l lineend"]
00234     }
00235 
00236     # Create the regular expression containing the indent and unindent words
00237     set uni_re [join $indent_exprs($txt,unindent) |]
00238 
00239     # Find the last open brace starting from the current insertion point
00240     while {[$txt compare $currpos < $endpos]} {
00241 
00242       # Get the current line
00243       set line [$txt get $currpos "$currpos lineend"]
00244 
00245       # Remove the leading whitespace and modify it to match the current indentation level
00246       if {[regexp {^(\s*)(.*)} $line -> whitespace rest]} {
00247         if {[string length $whitespace] > 0} {
00248           $txt delete $currpos "$currpos+[string length $whitespace]c"
00249         }
00250         if {[regexp "^(\\\\)*($uni_re)" $rest -> escapes unindent_match] && \
00251             ![expr [string length $escapes] % 2]} {
00252           set unindent [[ns preferences]::get Editor/IndentSpaces]
00253         } else {
00254           set unindent_match ""
00255           set unindent       0
00256         }
00257         if {$indent_space ne ""} {
00258           $txt insert $currpos [set indent_space [string range $indent_space $unindent end]]
00259         }
00260         append indent_space [get_indent_space $txt "$currpos+[expr [string length $unindent_match] + [string length $indent_space]]c" "$currpos lineend"]
00261       } else {
00262         append indent_space [get_indent_space $txt $currpos "$currpos lineend"]
00263       }
00264 
00265       # Increment the starting position to the next line
00266       set currpos [$txt index "$currpos+1l linestart"]
00267 
00268     }
00269 
00270     # Perform syntax highlighting
00271     [winfo parent $txt] highlight $startpos $endpos
00272 
00273   }
